laboratory_examinations.findings: Gallbladder wall thickening measuring up to 10 mm. The GB is mildly distended. A calcified gallstone is demonstrated within the gallbladder neck. No focal or textural abnormalities in the liver. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation with the common bile duct measuring up to 3 mm. The main portal vein is patent with appropriate hepatopetal flow. No pericholecystic fluid.
1.9 mg/dL (reference range: 1.6 - 2.6 mg/dL), within normal range.
